title: App hung many times

title: App keep freezing
text: Frequent app freezing severely disrupts. Despite the app’s promising features, I’m forced to restart it over 10 times daily due to unresponsiveness. This issue makes it impossible to like, comment, or engage effectively.

LinkedIn should do a better job of hiding a users email even if it’s a business account

I’m walking away from LinkedIn for a bit because the anger is too much.

title: I feel uneasy about logging in
text: I’ve had LinkedIn for a while I used it quite often had a job because of it, then, unfortunately, I just recently am unemployed again so I decided to download LinkedIn again. When I try to login, it said security check, which is an abnormal at all but when I did so it send me a code to my email, and when I go to find the code, it comes in as Alice and on the title and some Chinese words, I’m gonna click on the email all you can see is the code and American English and then the rest is all Chinese. Never used to do that before I find it odd and I feel like I have just given away all of my personal information to some that has taken over your app.

title: Hange
text: Recently App in iPhone 13 hange when it reach to a video post.

title: Denied
text: Used this app for 10 years and all of a sudden, denied access, had to upload my drivers license, wait for 48 hours..only to be denied access over and over. I’m trying one more time but after this, no more. Not to mention getting a text message from some Chinese symbols with a verification code!? Then I’m expected to upload my drivers license for security purposes?? Seems very shady

title: Cancel Culture at LinkedIn
text: As a career nuclear power industry professional with deep experience and long track record of success, I have the potential to make significant constructive contributions to your forum. However, I dared to disagree with a fascist Marxist political comment and you suspended my account. You want me to bend a knee and kiss your leftist ring in order to be reinstated. I will not. That’s your choice. You have more to gain from my participation than I do. Good luck but I will never capitulate on a matter of principle. You would do well to stay out of politics but if you’re going to allow it from one side, you should not interfere with those who disagree based on sound principle and our Constitution. Anyone who is a principled Constitutionalist should avoid LinkedIn.

title: Frustrated
text: Can you please fix your app. Every time I get a email about a job opening. If I try to apply through the email, it takes me to App Store every time, and will never open the posting unless I search for it separately on the app. Can someone please fix this???

title: Appalling moderation system - Avoid
text:
No longer a LinkedIn customer after many many years.  I recently ended a romantic relationship with someone who turned to this platform to repeatedly call me horrifying names; threaten me with ‘war’ among other things only for this platform to continue to allow him on the platform.  This platform is not worth it especially if you value your sanity and your safety esp even more if you’re a domestic violence survivor like I am.  Unacceptable! 

I am appalled at the audacity of LinkedIn and as a CEO and C-Suite executive (I hold two positions) I will ensure my peers know about this.  These flimsy moderation policies that social media suddenly has to appease a certain demographic so they can get away with bloody murder, is going to be the death of many platforms including LinkedIn.  Shame for LinkedIn we were in the process of launching a hiring blitz following a funding round but will be taking our business elsewhere.  This made LinkedIn completely untrustworthy in my eyes no question about it.

title: Another social site or what?
text: I will get notification after notification to add friends and whats going on in the world as far as companies on the app but not an application update.

title: So slow with lots of crashes

title: This app is fraud
text: I canceled my subscription during the free monthly trial period, and was still billed $184 for the premium. There’s nothing that justifies that kind of price tag.

text: Not great for finding jobs just people postings stuff about random job fields and such and won’t even contact you back when you inquire about positions they have “open”. Honestly it’s complete garbage.

title: Stop sending nudges at inappropriate times
text:
It’s midnight. Do I need to know that people with similar interests follow Paula? It’s 4am, do I know Sebastian? I do but don’t want to be connected with him and didn’t want to be when you asked 4-months ago. 

The random and sometimes repetitive nudges is one of the reasons I continue to disengage with the app.

title: Got charged for Premium that I never wanted
text:
I found out that I got subscribed to their premium linked in or whatever it is for $40. If kept popping up and must have got clicked but I can’t get refunded for it so the best advice I have everyone is to delete this app

Just another company that uses sketchy subscriptions to take money from you. LinkedIn is just becoming another Facebook. I am afraid to open the app again because I will probably get charged again.

title: Wish I could block an advertiser!
text:
I see the exact same advertiser in my feed as the 2nd post every time I open the app. I wish there was a way to block this ad — it’s a competitor to my husband’s firm and I keep seeing it because he lost two clients to that firm and they follow it and me.

Very annoying daily reminder.

Please fix this…

title: Not looking for a job
text: I am not looking for a job presently love this site especially all the beautiful architecture. !!!

title: LinkedIn: the essential social media
text:
LinkedIn is a top level networking technology tool that allows the introduction of those working in areas of interest to its audience. It allows its patrons to connect with those who work within their industry from all over the world, gather the newest information to improve their skill set, and keep abreast of where jobs and pay are most plentiful. However, I believe it’s biggest claim to fame is bringing in those generations or individuals who do not participate in standard social media. Those individuals who have something to say from a professional standpoint, but still see the value in getting likes. Discussions on LinkedIn, bring in both an educated and experience level discussion on topics that currently impact society, making it essential when measuring a dynamic group of informed minds.

Best regards,

Francine Shannon

title: Breach of Trust
text: I’ve gotten unwanted solicitations from headhunting agencies telling me they got my phone number from LinkedIn. I do not provide this information in my public profile and have indicated that I don’t wish to be contacted.

title: Still useful but now more annoying
text: LinkedIn, please get rid of the “Catch Up” feature. It is annoying.

title: I’m losing my reading place. Please give us control of feed refreshing
text: While I truly value my LinkedIn connections and their insightful posts, I’m growing more frustrated by the app behavior of auto-refreshing my feed causing me to lose my place. Argh! There are two aspects to this problem: 1) When I pause on a post and click a link to read that link’s content, I may step away from my phone for a bit, especially if that content is a long read. When my iPhone or iPad is reopened LinkedIn decides for me that it will refresh the feed and I lose my place. The same happens in the main LinkedIn feed. I don’t personally want that experience. I’d rather manually decide when I want to refresh and keep a static placeholder on where I left off my reading of posts. How can I do that? 2) For linked content via url, it would be best if you opened that content in a browser since the browser app would better allow me to retain the content as a static tab. For the basic LinkedIn feed, I’m not sure what to do. Yes, I know you offer a “save” feature; however I would normally only save something after reading most of the content and determining whether it’s worth saving. Isn’t that the “save” feature design intent? I’m sure LinkedIn developers didn’t mean for me to save everything I read just in case I might truly want to save it, then have to remove most of the saved content after I decide I don’t need to save it. Yes? That’s backwards. What happens is when I’ve just started reading a potentially intriguing LinkedIn post, then distracted by something else outside the app, it causes me to lose an otherwise valuable resource because the app refreshes my feed without my permission when return to the app. PLEASE, just give us control, e.g., let user set an “auto-refresh” toggle preference if they chose to do so, or set it as “manual refresh” wherein we can apply a top of screen pull down gesture to initiate the refresh. What do you say? Can do? I’m certain I’m not the only one frustrated by this happening. If this is an iOS problem I’m happy to also raise this with Apple, but I expect you to work with Apple to resolve it, please, and in the meantime figure out how to work around it to help users retain context to their stream. Thank you!

title: Eh it’s okay
text: LinkedIn is not as good as it once was. It became more like Facebook than a job search site. LinkedIn never found me a job even though I applied for several. LinkedIn does not give much help when it comes to resume building, networking, or help actually landing the job you qualify for. LinkedIn learning certifications are absolutely useless, I found better educational videos on topics using YouTube. The truth is LinkedIn has a reality distortion field, it makes you think you need it but you don’t. There are way too many spam accounts and I really wish people would stop messaging me, unasked by the way, to fix my resume. I really hate this site and it needs to die. Worst job website ever. If you pay for LinkedIn learning you are a sucker.

title: Good overall but I do wish there were more filtering options
text:
I’ve gotten a few jobs from indeed over the years, it’s a good site and generally you don’t come across an overwhelming number of fake or outdated job listings like you do other places.

The only improvement I’d wish to see is improved filters for wages. If there were an option to filter out jobs that don’t post the salary themselves or an option to filter out jobs that post salary ranges that would be great.

If you set your filter to something like $40,000 a year let’s say, many jobs will have a pay range listed with the high end within your desired salary, but a low end that’s far lower.

It is also frustrating to look for “Entry level” or “No experience required” jobs and need to scroll through dozens of jobs that require bachelors or masters degrees in specific fields. I understand those can still be entry level, but it would be really convenient to filter out jobs that require specific degrees. Often times the existing options aren’t capable of this. 

Good app tho

title: Incredibly slow.
text: Comprehensive app when it wants to work. Incredibly slow.

title: App crashes when viewing followers
text: App crashes while view followers profiles

title: Very bad and buggy app
text: This app is horrible. Scrolling through jobs is a time consuming nightmare as the app is constantly freezing. I’m always on the latest phone os and app version yet this problem has persisted for over a year. LinkedIn needs a new dev team
